Title: Head of Renewables and Energy Storage Singapore & AFRY Singapore Office Head
RoleDescription:
In line with our increasing business, we are looking for Head of Renewables and Energy Storage Singapore & AFRY Singapore Office Head to have overall responsibility for our renewable energy consulting business in Singapore and to act as Head of our Singapore office. ResponsibilitiesYour scope of work will include the following:Overall responsibility for renewable energy consulting services in Singapore and with
Singaporean clients, including solar PV/ wind farm/battery storage due diligence, feasibility study, EPC tendering and lenders technical and environmental advisory services, covering strategy, proposals, project supervision, reporting, quality control and customer satisfaction.Active business development of AFRYs energy related services to Singapore-based clients, including AFRYs energy management consulting services (market studies, price projections, strategy studies), transaction services (market, commercial, technical and environmental & social due diligences), technical advisory services (feasibility study, EPC tendering, lenders technical advisory services, owners engineer services) for various renewable energy sector projects but also assisting other AFRYs energy segments in business development in the country for waste to energy, gas/LNG-fired power plants, CCS, green hydrogen/ammonia, biomass to power, power transmission, interconnectors, and nuclear power. This includes also interfacing with Singapore clients regarding their interests outside of Singapore itself / in other countries or regions that AFRY covers (with support from AFRY personnel in such other regions or countries)Acting as Project Manager or Project Director (depending on the project) for selected renewable energy consulting projects in Singapore.Recruitment of new renewable energy team members focusing on renewable energy consulting work. Line management of the renewable energy consulting team including overseeing the teams current and expected workload.Coordinating resources for renewable energy consulting projects in Singapore projects, from among the 50+ AFRY wind power experts and 120+ solar PV experts working in APAC region, and with AFRYs renewable energy experts in Europe and other regions.Participation or management of various other technical consulting assignments.Preparation of reports for the clients as required and quality control for the internal report preparation process.Leadership regarding AFRYs Singapore office, line management (either through solid or dotted lines) of the AFRY Singapore staff.Ensure the application of AFRYs group guidelines and other internal and external policies in order to guarantee a sustainable and compliant conduct of business.Short term travel expected in projects and to support business development in the APAC region.Higher professional degree in engineering field relevant for the job (B.Sc. or higher)Industry background and more than 10 years work experience from power utilities, IPP developers, engineering companies, or power sector consulting companiesGood connections with local energy sector clients in SingaporeGood experience in renewable energy project development phaseFluency in EnglishExcellent report writing, presentation and verbal communication skillsGood experience in client interactionAbility to work well with people from a range of culturesAbility to work independentlyProactive personality, drive and energyWe offer the following to qualified candidates:Friendly international working environment with a wide variety of interesting and challenging tasksCompetitive salary packageCareer opportunity in one of the largest international consulting and engineering companiesPossibility to grow professionally and advance in careerPossibility to work in renewable energy projects across the APAC region.Additional InformationAFRY is committed to creating an inclusive & diverse environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, disability, or age. You will be part of a global and diverse company where our differences are our strengths. Join us to accelerate the transition towards a sustainable society. At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. Thats how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.

Title: Hovedbyggeleder
RoleDescription:
Vi i Advansia skal bidra til at Norge fr til mer for mindre. Vre bunnsolide metoder og sterke kultur gjr oss til en foretrukken samarbeidspartner  men vi tar ikke denne posisjonen for gitt. Det er laget vrt som gjr oss sterke, og gjennom vre tjenester skaper vi samfunn som gir vekst for bedrifter, organisasjoner og gode liv for innbyggerne. N inviterer vi deg til  bli en del av dette viktige laget.

Som hovedbyggeleder i Advansia fr du ansvar for  lede komplekse byggeplasser der kravene til fremdrift, sikkerhet, kvalitet og samhandling er hye. Du fr en sentral rolle i  representere byggherren, og du sikrer at prosjektene gjennomfres etter de hyeste profesjonelle standardene. Rollen gir deg bde faglig tyngde og synlighet  du er lederen som setter retningen ute p byggeplassen og srger for at alle parter trekker i samme retning.Vi ser etter deg som:har solid erfaring fra byggeledelse eller prosjektledelse, gjerne i store offentlige prosjekterer trygg i kontraktsoppflging, risikostyring og fremdriftsplanleggingevner  lede og motivere tverrfaglige team under komplekse rammebetingelserkommuniserer tydelig og bygger tillit bde hos byggherre, entreprenr og vrige interessenterhar hy personlig integritet og mot til  st i krevende beslutningerHva fr du hos oss?
I Advansia fr du en rolle med stort ansvar og hy innflytelse. Du blir en del av Norges fremste prosjektmilj, og fr muligheten til  lede prosjekter som setter standarden for byggeledelse i Norge. Vi tilbyr konkurransedyktige betingelser, gode pensjons- og forsikringsordninger, fem uker ferie samt fri i romjul og pske. Du fr ogs fleksibilitet i arbeidshverdagen, og tilgang til et sterkt fagmilj hvor erfaringer deles pent.Hvorfor Advansia?
Fordi vi leder prosjektene som former fremtidens samfunn  og fordi vi gjr det med profesjonalitet, integritet og lagnd. Som hovedbyggeleder hos oss vil du oppleve bde utfordringene og gleden ved  ha en sentral lederrolle i prosjekter som har varig betydning for Norge.Interessert?
Last opp din CV. Vi vurderer kandidater fortlpende  grip muligheten til  lede de prosjektene som virkelig teller.

Title: Driven projektkoordinator inom IT
RoleDescription: Are you a newly graduated engineer interested in a challenging but developing assignment at a company with sustainability in their DNA? Look no further!AFRY is currently undergoing substantial changes regarding the IT environment. Old and slow solutions are replaced with modern software with more capability and finesse. One very important upgrade is that of the ERP-system. The upgrade will be done in steps, based on the geographical location of AFRY offices.As a project coordinator your role will be to support the roll-out teams with the roll-out of the ERP-solution. These teams have different geographical locations and might run into different challenges. It could be anything from aiding the organization in trainings to validate updates. You will be stationed at AFRY headquarters in Solna but will have contact with project members located nationally and internationally. Currently the majority of the work can be performed from a distance but possibility to work 100% from Solna-office is expected. To get a good start at us we believe that you are a newly graduated engineer, ready for an exciting challenge! Since the project is working in an international environment your English needs to be fluent. Speaking Swedish is considered very meritorious.We are looking for someone with excellent presentation and communication skills. Since you will have a coordinating role, good knowledge of MS Office and online collaboration tools such as Teams and Sharepoint are necessary.Basic understanding of IT-development and a general interest in IT topics are needed. Learning new systems comes naturally to you and you are able to quickly get up to speed to support more senior employees with various tasks.As a person you should be:Able to think and act on your own - ability to take ownership of the role is a mustEager to contribute  not be afraid to reach out and sometimes nag a little to gain progress.Organized  notice possible discrepancies and make sure they are handled accordinglyHave a strong personal drive in your workThe ERP project will hopefully run for many years and if you perform satisfactory during your temporary employment you will get the opportunity to participate during the entire roll-out.If you recognize yourself in the above description - don't wait to send your application! We are continuously looking at applications and look forward to hearing from you!The last day to apply is 2025-10-13AFRY's Future concept gives you a competitive path into the job market. The concept is carried out in collaboration with the client and during the assignment you get to test the consultant role while gaining good insight into a very exciting client from day 1. After completing the Future assignment, the client's ambition is to offer the consultant a permanent position.Read more about our Future path here https://afry.com/sv/afry-future-graduate-programFor questions about the position or the Future concept, contact the recruiting manager at paulina.araus@afry.comFor questions regarding the recruitment process, contact recruitment partner Fanny Sjdell, fanny.sjodell@afry.comAt AFRY, we drive change in everything we do.
